title: Shaco: Jungle beginner guide

embed.description: Beginner guide to jungling as shaco Request if you want advanced jungling tactic as shaco tutorial =) Follow me: http://www.twitch.tv/dreampischu Subscribe and thumbs up if you liked the video!

body: A simple jungle guide: If anyone is interested in advanced techniques in shaco jungle feel free to request

replies.body:
Yo dog!  I liked the video :-)

I do things a little differently, I place two boxes at krugs and two boxes at red buff.  I smite the krugs for the stun bonus and place a third box at the red camp after I finish krugs.  I place the boxes out of the red camp's range so they don't activate until I leash the red buff.  It ends up at ~75% hp.
I do this too but I save smite for the Red buff and ask bot lane for help on Krugs. Since Smite is on the ammo system it will be back up for Blue buff no matter who you smited.  xD

> [{quoted}](name=Riot PhillyBrew,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=UfGWyVIa,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-14T06:29:46.535+0000)
>
> Yo dog!  I liked the video :-)
> 
> I do things a little differently, I place two boxes at krugs and two boxes at red buff.  I smite the krugs for the stun bonus and place a third box at the red camp after I finish krugs.  I place the boxes out of the red camp's range so they don't activate until I leash the red buff.  It ends up at ~75% hp.

Yes that is another version of a clear, but it is a little big more complex for beginners.  Also, by smiting krugs, the smite cooldown will be up by the time shaco reaches blue =). The disadvantages are that your first clear becomes a little bit slower meaning your first buff could get countered by the enemy jungler (if he comes to counter) and you wont have smite to safely secure the buff.

Look I respect the work you put into this... but I really find both of the best paths for Shaco start with red buff alone.

1. Do red without smite, hop dragon/baron wall, show up to enemy ~~red~~(opps meant to type blue) with smite and steal it...

2. smite red for even faster red, run mid and gank, wolves, blue, return to gank mid or gank top or do crab and recall.

> [{quoted}](name=Ark Angel HFB,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=UfGWyVIa,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-14T11:27:23.533+0000)
>
> Look I respect the work you put into this... but I really find both of the best paths for Shaco start with red buff alone.
> 
> 1. Do red without smite, hop dragon wall, show up to enemy red with smite and steal it...
> 
> 2. smite red for even faster red, run mid and gank, wolves, blue, return to gank mid or gank top or do crab and recall.

For option 1, their multiplte possibilities that could lead to shaco becoming irrelevant if it fails:
- The other jungle may smite his red properly (you end up wasting your time)
-The jungler could be stronger than you(Strong early game junglers can sometimes out damage shaco)
- You currently have 1 camp of exp, even after stealing his red, you are still lvl 2 (killing him isnt always 100% assured)
For option 1 to make it worthwhile, we would have to: Kill him and get his red.

Option: 2 - This is actually a viable option as shaco but you show yourself on the map and the other jungler can easily see where you are going
(this option depends on actually managing to get their mid to use sumonners spells or get a kill on them).
-Either way, unless you get a kill, you will fall a little bit behind in exp compared to the other jungler and top/bot will know where you are and your jungle pressure will lower.

> [{quoted}](name=Yu Chen,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=UfGWyVIa,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-03-14T23:09:17.640+0000)

> For option 1, their multiplte possibilities that could lead to shaco becoming irrelevant if it fails:
> - The other jungle may smite his red properly (you end up wasting your time)
> -The jungler could be stronger than you(Strong early game junglers can sometimes out damage shaco)
> - You currently have 1 camp of exp, even after stealing his red, you are still lvl 2 (killing him isnt always 100% assured)
> For option 1 to make it worthwhile, we would have to: Kill him and get his red.
> 
> Option: 2 - This is actually a viable option as shaco but you show yourself on the map and the other jungler can easily see where you are going
> (this option depends on actually managing to get their mid to use sumonners spells or get a kill on them).
> -Either way, unless you get a kill, you will fall a little bit behind in exp compared to the other jungler and top/bot will know where you are and your jungle pressure will lower.

Sorry I miss type'd. I meant hop the dragon/baron wall from your red and show up at the enemy blue. With the proper runes and masteries you will be there very fast.

Normally, and yes this does depend on a few things, the enemy will ether NOT be to his blue in time to stop you... or will have done grump and will be smite-less half way through his blue. It is very easy to smite the blue away, but don't stop there. If the enemy is low fight him, but more importantly take the two small minions at the blue camp that will be low from the enemy grump buff.
Interesting, I main shaco top so I've never gotten around to learning how to jungle with him, specially sense the new jungle hurts so much.

> [{quoted}](name=biomaster,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=UfGWyVIa,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-03-14T15:47:58.623+0000)
>
> Interesting, I main shaco top so I've never gotten around to learning how to jungle with him, specially sense the new jungle hurts so much.

Shaco still manages very well to go trough the jungle as his boxes tank for him, and his shiv makes the monster miss their attacks on him
